[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@rushstack/node-core-library](./node-core-library.md) &gt; [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)

## IPackageJsonExports interface

This interface is part of the [IPackageJson](./node-core-library.ipackagejson.md) file format. It is used for the values of the "exports" field.

See [Node.js documentation on Conditional Exports](https://nodejs.org/api/packages.html#conditional-exports) and [Node.js documentation on Community Conditional Exports](https://nodejs.org/api/packages.html#community-conditions-definitions)<></>.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface IPackageJsonExports 
```

## Properties

<table><thead><tr><th>

Property


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

["node-addons"?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports._node-addons_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export is like [IPackageJsonExports.node](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.node.md) in that it matches for any NodeJS environment. This export is specifically for native C++ addons.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[browser?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.browser.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Any web browser environment.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[default?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.default.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches as a fallback when no other conditions match. Because exports are evaluated in the order that they are specified in the `package.json` file, this condition should always come last as no later exports will match if this one does.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[development?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.development.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches in development-only environments. This is always mutually exclusive with [IPackageJsonExports.production](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.production.md)<></>.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[import?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.import.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches when loaded via ESM syntax (i.e. - `import '...'` or `import('...')`<></>). This is always mutually exclusive with [IPackageJsonExports.require](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.require.md)<></>.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[node?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.node.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches for any NodeJS environment.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[production?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.production.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches in production-only environments. This is always mutually exclusive with [IPackageJsonExports.development](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.development.md)<></>.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[require?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.require.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches when loaded via `require()`<></>. This is always mutually exclusive with [IPackageJsonExports.import](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.import.md)<></>.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[types?](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.types.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| [IPackageJsonExports](./node-core-library.ipackagejsonexports.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ This export matches when loaded by the typing system (i.e. - the TypeScript compiler).


</td></tr>
